headline: Coconut Cream Pound Cake
description: This coconut pound cake is made extra moist with cream cheese and flavored with coconut extract and flaked coconut for a crowd-pleasing treat.

video.description: This decadent pound cake has a creamy coconut twist!
video.name: Coconut Cream Pound Cake

name: Coconut Cream Pound Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.

Beat butter and cream cheese together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until blended; add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Blend in eggs one at a time, then stir in coconut extract. Mix in flour and baking powder until just moistened; stir in flaked coconut. Spoon batter into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes; run a table knife around the edges to loosen, then invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack. Let cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Do not make this as a tube or bundt cake. The cake isn’t bad, but is dry. It’s very fluffy but will benefit from frosting. I’d make this as a layer cake with frosting next time. And that’s after including many of the suggestions made in the reviews.

Yum! i just made and enjoyed some of this cake. i had dissected (unsweetened) coconut that I post with about 3 tablespoons of olive oil as per another suggestion. The only other change I made was I use 2 1/2 cups of sugar. My cake is super moist. I cooked it for the time it called for, then turned off the oven and left it for another 15 to 17 minutes. Thanks for this recipe.

The taste of this cake is pretty nice but it’s too dry. I reduced the flour and even added some milk hoping to avoid a dry cake (based on the reviews) but it was still dry. Very disappointed. It’s definitely not worth the time making it again.
It tasted great and looked nice but mine over baked and was quite dry and crumbly once sliced. After 1 hr and 10 minutes it was VERY done in my oven. I wish I had checked it sooner.

The pound cake was just satisfactory. It was too poundy and was in need of more creme. Otherwise, the coconut flavours worked really well. In the future, i would recommend including mayonnaise into the wet ingredients to ensure the moisture stays present.
It wasn’t instantly dry but after the first 24 is did crumble more than expected. Had some grilled in a pan with butter to help finish the rest of it off. Other than that I enjoyed the flavor.

I made this and did what a few others suggested. I added an extra 1/2 teasp. of coconut extract, 1/2 cup less sugar, and made sure I beat the butter, cream cheese, & sugar until it was fluffy & added one egg at a time. It was delicious!!!

I used 2.5 cup of sugar still sweet will decrease sugar to 2 cups I also used unsweetened coconut , did not like texture flavor . Cake very heavy I will make next week with cake flour. There was so much batter for a regular Bundt pan.

I made this cake but with a couple of the changes suggested by other reviewers. I added an extra stick of butter and cut the sugar by a half cup. I baked it in a 13 x 9 pan because I don’t have great luck with bundt cakes-dark edges or not coming out of the pan without breaking. I started baking it for 30 minutes and then testing every 2 minutes after for maybe 10-12 more minutes. I found the cake dry and crumbly so not sure what the answer is-also add canola or vegetable oil? It had a really good flavor but the texture bothered me. Maybe I cooked it too long but the middle still seemed jiggly so I’d leave it in for a couple more minutes.
Delicious and very easy to make. Moist, flavorful but not overly sweet. Very easy to cut and holds its shape. A keeper.
Fabulous recipe - took the advice and beat the bejeebers out of the eggs and sugar. Added a little extra coconut extract, but this cake was spot on. It tasted like a macaroon cookie.

Made in bundt pan as directed except used 2 1/2 cups sugar to cut sweetness. Baked for 1 hour 20 minutes. Toothpick came out clean, top looked brown, so took out of oven. Let cool for 10 minutes, then took out of pan. Entire middle collapsed. I am very upset as this was to be our Easter dessert.

This is such an easy recipe to follow. I made a few alterations to the ingredients though. I used 3 sticks of butter and added vanilla flavoring along with the coconut flavoring. I also made a glaze to top the cake. I will definitely make it again
I enjoyed making it and did not make any changes.

Very good but dry. I did not frost it but probably should have, or at least a cream sauce, given the dryness. I put the coconut in the food processor and am glad I did. The smaller pieces were more pleasant to eat. I used 1 t. baking powder and added 1/2 t. vanilla extract. I would make this again with the following changes: 1 1/2 t. coconut extract, 1/2 t. vanilla extract, 1 t. baking powder. I would still put the coconut in the food processor but afterwards I would soak it in milk or coconut milk for added moisture.
I made this and it turned out great. I do think is a bit dry but that could be from cooking in a microwave convection oven. We topped with cool whip and that makes it yummy!
This cake is delicious. I toasted the coconut for 5 minutes at 325 degrees and let cool before adding it to the batter.
No changes, absolutely wonderful.

This is my second time making this recipe. It is so delicious and so easy to make. It makes the whole house smells so yummy. I did alter the recipe just a bit, I use three sticks of butter instead of two. I added 1/8 of a teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. My daughter and her friends love when I make it for them.
I use vanilla extract instead of coconut extract because I didn’t have it, but at the end It taste delicious. I love it and my family too.

This recipe was easy to follow. After reading other reviews I decided to use three sticks of butter instead of two. I also did not have any coconut extract so I used a teaspoon each of both vanilla and rum. this cake will be my go-to cake.

Delicious, moist and flavorful
Coconut cake 
always been my favorite cake to make I'm so glad I found this recipe
Made this for my husband’s birthday. I made zero changes other than chopping Trader Joe’s unsweetened flaked coconut before adding to the batter. Great recipe!
Delicious. I added 1 2/2 cups of fresh cranberries I had frozen. This added 10 minutes to the cooking time.
I decided to toast the coconut because I dislike the texture otherwise. A bit too sweet I would probably only use about 2.5 cups of sugar next time
Loved everything about this! Came out perfectly! And it was my first pound cake too!
I eliminated an entire cup of sugar (only used 2c) and was still pretty sweet for me. I also did not use the shredded coconut and still thought it was very good - my picky kids loved it.

Yummy. I used 2 loaf pans for about 1 1/2 hours. I also used 1 Tbl of coconut extract but no coconut pieces and added 1/4 tsp salt because my butter was unsalted. Not dry at all, very dense. Some people tasted coconut and some didn't, but all liked it (except the person that hates coconut).

Made a low sugar version with 1 c granulated sugar and 1 cup lakanto sugar substitute instead of 3 cups of sugar and it was still good . Just a little dry and crumbly as others have said in their reviews.
Way too sweet for me. A bit heavy but it taste good.

Made this for Easter and was very disappointed. I love coconut but this cake just tasted like butter- way too rich and not pleasing to the palette even though I followed the recipe exactly. It wasn't even edible which is sad because it had so many ingredients.

Honestly it was ok. Not great, not bad. I didn’t find it to be dry at all, but it is very sweet. A little on the heavy side for pound cake. Very good with coffee. I added a little more coconut flavor and it still has an overwhelming cream cheese taste.
I made this for my friends and work employees and everyone loved it. This would be perfect for Easter. Also goes very well with coffee. Perfect to handout when you have friends over. Love it!

So this cake was a little too dry for me. I did cut the sugar as was suggested in many of the reviews and I’m glad I did. I drizzled a copious amount of buttermilk glaze on it and it was awesome. Thanks for the recipe!!
good in theory but a bit too thick for me. I feel.like I need to dunk it in coffee or milk. if I make it again, I'll surely make some changes as suggested... less sugar & higher quality coconut.
I made this exactly as described, and it turned out great. The cake has velvety soft pound cake texture.

Delicious! I made this cake last night for my husband's birthday...Not really, he gets a Carrot Cake for his birthday which is this weekend. At any rate, after browsing the reviews and reading the recipe, I could not resist making this cake!
Review and comments:
Great cake! Richy moist, buttery, really nice crumb, and very easy to make. I made the following adjustment after reading the reviews.
 I added 1 stick of butter (1 1/2 cups). 
I used one teaspoon of both vanilla and almond extract (next time I will add 2 teaspoons, almond only). 
 Finally, I toasted then grind the Unsweetened Coconut Flakes before stirred the coconut into the cake. The baking time at 325 degrees - 1 hour 20 minutes. Perfections!

My family does not like pieces of coconut in things but we all like the taste of coconut so I toasted the coconut first and then put it in a small processor to make it into a powder, then I used it in the recipe! They loved it! Toasting it enhances the flavor!
Awesome !

made in a bunt pan. needed to increase bake time to 1:45. 
first time I made I baked in small loaf pans (4) could have used one more pan. 
Next time Im going to try larger flaked coconut. Gonna play around with this recipe.

Easy to make. Changed recipe a bit - 1 cup of sugar, 1 cup of sweetened coconut, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, 1 teaspoon of coconut extract and vanilla pudding mix. Cake was a hit - definitely will make it again!
Tasty with the coconut

My cake came out hard on the outside and very dry. I really wanted to like this cake. It took forever for the knife to come out clean so it was probably overcooked. It was way to sweet for my liking. I read reviews after I baked it for tips on maybe adding less sugar and another stick of butter. However, I don’t think I’ll bake this one again.
First time making this. Absolutely a hit. I made a coconut glaze topping.
This cake was really moist and delicious. I changed the recipe to 2 teaspoons of coconut extract and 1 and 3/4 cup of sugar.
If you love macaroons you should love this coconut pound cake. Top it with strawberries, chocolate sauce or serve it plain, it is delicious.

Wonderful flavor, moist and the best pound cake i have eaten!
I made it just like the recipe. I did put a glaze on top to which I added coconut extract.
This will be my go to take for pot lucks
I’m always asked to make pound cakes this one is everyone’s favorite
Big beautiful cake. Several said delicious! I’ll make it again but cook it a bit shorter time than I did.
This cake was awesome.. It was a hit at the office .

I made half the recipe and it was very good. I used 1 1/4 c of sugar, and I still think 1 cup would be enough. I toasted a bit of the coconut to enhance the coconut flavor. The golden bits inside looked pretty. I doubled the coconut flavor too, but with the toasted coconut it could be fine to add less coconut flavoring. The cake is dense but not too dry. It yielded about 12 cupcakes. If you bake in dark pans, beware that you might need to lower the temperature to 300F given that this cake benefits from slow baking. The sugar of the coconut will add to the batter plus it can cause over browning. Like others suggest use less sugar and beat the cream cheese and butter well and after adding the sugar. Make sure the sugar/butter mix catches enough air for a lightweight result. Will make this again.

I made this cake and added my own twist of pineapple juice.
Its a dense pound cake. The flavor is very good I also substituted the cream for sour cream which gave it a not so sweet to the taste. I plan to make it again.
This was very delicious and moist - I followed the recipe.

Very forgiving recipe! Read all the reviews and noted that for the most part it always turned out regardless of any small tweaks. My granddaughter had loved it the first time I made it and then told her whole preschool that her Nona was making coconut cake again for the 4th of July family gathering with strawberries on top!

I’m not sure if i did something different than the other reviewers but i followed the directions exactly and this cake turned out crumbly. It had an ok taste but not easy to eat as it just fell apart.
I added about half a cup of coconut cream, didn't have any trouble with it being dry. I used desiccated coconut as well, love the taste of it!
I left out the coconut flakes and added 1/2 teaspoon more coconut extract. SOOOOO YUMMY!! a must try!!!

I like the taste. I made it as the recipe says except I only used 2.5 cups of sugar. I used a Bundt pan to bake it. I only baked it for an hour and 10 minutes, which was too long. The crust on the cake was very dark- not burned, but dark. That tells me too much sugar (as it was plenty sweet)and baked too long. I'll make it again with some additional adjustments.

I made this cake and even after following all directions to the letter it seems to be a little dry. Any suggestions would be great I thought about using 1/2 cup of Coconut to see if that would help. A delicious cake in spite of dryness.
The flavor was good, not too much of a coconut flavor but the cake was very dense. Very heavy consistency and it was not a light and fluffy cake.

Not a real pound cake, texture more like a regular cake
Nothing special, though easy to make.

This is probably on me but I used 1/2 cup of coconut sugar as a partial substitute for the generous amount of sugar called for in the recipe. It rose beautifully, but was dry and I did not like the texture. At this point I would not make it again.
I used 2 cups of sugar, and I put 2tbs of canola oil w) the coconut in a blender first. The batter is thick.
Really dry and grainy texture. Very disappointing and will not make again
I made this cake today and it is wonderful. I used the lower fat cream cheese and I baked it another10 minutes. I did have trouble getting it out of the pan in 1 piece. It is definitely a keeper!

I’m normally not a fan of changing the recipe as it’s written, at least for my first try. However, this recipe has so many good reviews, and so many of them recommended changes. So I followed my instincts and some of the tips. I added a teaspoon of vanilla, a teaspoon of salt and 4 tablespoons of coconut oil, and I reduced the sugar by 1/2 cup. I baked in a 4qt (10x15) rectangular baking dish for 65 minutes at the specified temperature. I wish I had taken it out 5-7 minutes sooner, but - this is a fabulous, basic recipe that you can tweak or customize to your taste and produce a wonderful, dense and flavorful pound cake.
I loved the coconut flavor, but the cake seemed a little dry. served with fresh berries and whipped cream/lemon curd mixture.
I loved the coconut flavor, but the cake seemed a little dry. served with fresh berries and whipped cream/lemon curd mixture.
Gone in 2 days! Will definitely make again!
This is wonderful scrumptious cake

I made this wonderful cake w/Cup4Cup flour so it was gluten free. It was great. It goes in the keeper file and next time I will reduce the sugar, add vanilla and try the 300 degree oven. I might even try 3 sticks of butter!
Will definitely make again
Light butter and cream cheese in same amount and yes I will make it again

This cake is amazing! My husband wants me to make it once a week! I did have trouble the first time as it was not done after the prescribed time. I am making it again for a party and am going to try a 350 degree oven for 60 minutes and then adjust as necessary.

I found this to be very dry and therefore gave it a 2. I would not make it again. I moistened it with strawberry sauce ( maybe the flavor was not the right one to choose) but it did not help enough. I might have made a good base for bread pudding?

Followed directions exactly .
Even read your article on butter cakes. Made sure all was at room temp. Beat butter and cream cheese and sugar for 7 minutes. Thought cake was much too sweet. Sorry I didn’t read comments before. It also requires much more oven time than 1 hr. 20 minutes. I call it a “ton” cake not a pound cake. Very disappointed. Intended to take to a friend but won’t
Delicious, moist, bests cake ever???
beautiful when i took it out of the oven, but dry and crumbly - not even close to consistency of a pound cake. guess should have added extra butter or oil as other reviewers did...
Excellent cake-just be sure and watch it about the last 15 minutes. In my oven, an hour and twenty minutes would have been too long.
To die for - everyone went wild for it and I actually had a friend ask me to make it for them for their birthday party!

Moist and flavorful! I followed the recipe for the cake exactly and wouldn't change a thing, it tasted and smelled delicious, and stayed moist for a week while we ate it. For the icing, I only used 1 cup of powdered sugar and it was just the right sweetness for us, so you can easily adjust for your liking. My husband shared some with a coworker and he loved it too!

This turned out fantastic ! I followed one of the suggestions to cut back on the sugar and It was still sweet enough. It did end up being a little on the dry side so I think I would possibly add extra butter. But with all that said we topped ours with fresh strawberries as another reviewer had suggested and you could not ask for a better dessert ! I would be very confident to take this cake anywhere ! Thank you for sharing the recipe as it is a keeper!!
I prepared the cake as described without any changes; came out great. Everyone loved it, especially the icing.

It was a hit and I did two cakes and put them together like strawberry shortcake 
Definitely was more moist after it was a few days old though

Definitely enjoyed this, brought to work & everyone raved about it. It would have been great served with strawberries, plan to do that next time. Decreased sugar to 2 & 1/2 cups. Baked in bundt pan for 10 minutes longer

Okay I'm going to echo most of the other reviews...
Dry, heavy, like a rock etc. etc. etc. Followed the recipe per the letter. After reading other reviewers and their attempts to invigorate this recipe we're going to cut our losses and move on, not a keeper.
D E L I C I O U S!!!!!!

This cake is delicious. I topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream...crazy good! I also agree that the cake is a bit dry. I’m not a baker so what can I do to make a more moist cake? Maybe I should have made a bundt and a loaf bc I had too much batter for one cake. I’ll add 1/2 tsp more of coconut extract. I will definitely make this cake again and again!!!

This was one of the best cakes I've ever made. Everyone loved it. After reading others' reviews - I did make some personal tweaks. I only used 5 eggs because I was using a bundt pan & was afraid it may not be big enough. The bundt pan worked perfectly fine. Because some folks suggested adding more butter - I just added little canola oil - maybe 1/4 cup. Also, at others' suggestion - I added little milk - probably about 1/4 to 1/3 cup. Mine cooked about 1 hour & 10 minutes. Delicious! I will probably make for mother-in-law - for our Mother's Day gathering. Thanks for a great recipe, as well as for helpful reviews!
very good, would even put a light glaze over top. And would try as a three layer cake ommiting coconut and use strawberries and whip cream
Took this to a potluck and it was a great!
It was a hit, this will be in the rotation!
I used 2 cups sugar and baked it for 1 hour 20 minutes. Flavor is very good, but it’s a bit dry. Will be good with coffee. Not sure if I’ll make it again.

Taste delicious. I substituted shredded coconut for flakes. I added some coconut cream too by adding only three quarter of the required cream cheese, as I don't have coconut essence. A small part of the cake is abit crumbly as I turned over the cake out of the pan. Otherwise its nice and crunchy due the coconut shreds that I like.

changes:
1 & 1/2 t coconut extract
1 t vanilla
1 c mini chocolate chips

I made two batches and baked in 4 regular and 1 mini loaf pan. Gave 4 loaves away and received many complements. I liked the taste and texture - I used chips instead of a glaze or frosting .
It was a good tasting cake but it took longer in my binder pan and I kept testing but must have missed a window. Needed to come out about 3 minutes earlier but it needed to bake about 1.25 minutes

Made this exactly as written. Delicious! We don't keep desserts in my home usually, but this sounded too good to not try. My husband said I am welcome to make it anytime. Will definitely be making this one again.
Was delicious easy
It had a good taste but very dry
